note.p: Request a free *[link:Alpha Anywhere Community Edition@https://www.alphasoftware.com/build-apps-for-free-community-edition-download]* license if you do not have one.

description.p: When the download completes, run the installer. You may be prompted to update the installer. Click the *[ui:Update]* button to apply the update.
Windows User Account Control may ask you if you want to run the installer. Click "Yes" to continue.
On the *[ui:Available]* tab, locate the Developer Edition and click the *[ui:Install]* button.
Run the installer to completion. This typically takes 5 minutes.

If prompted to reboot, reboot your computer and rerun the installer. You may see this prompt if you have pending Windows Updates or have installed another product that requires a reboot. A pending reboot may prevent the Alpha Anywhere installation from completing.
You can optionally click *[ui:Continue]*, however it is strongly recommended that you reboot your system before continuing with the installation.
Alpha Anywhere requires a license number to run. You will be prompted to enter your license the first time you run the software.
Launch Alpha Anywhere. This can be done by clicking the *[ui:Launch]* button on the *[ui:Installed]* tab in the Universal Installer or by opening the app from the Windows Start Menu.

Locate your license number. If you do not have a license, you can *[extlink:request a free Community Edition license@https://www.alphasoftware.com/build-apps-for-free-community-edition-download]*. If you purchased an Alpha Anywhere subscription and cannot locate your license, contact custserv@alphasoftware.com.
Enter your Alpha Anywhere license number and click OK.

figure.title: The registration screen is shown when you launch Alpha Anywhere for the first time.

description.p: Great! Now that Alpha Anywhere is installed and registered, we can start building an app.
